Identify the variable corresponding to each model coefficient

Source: R/tidy_identify_variables.R
tidy_identify_variables.Rd

tidy_identify_variables() will add to the tidy tibble three additional columns: variable, var_class and var_type.

tidy_identify_variables(x, model = tidy_get_model(x))

Arguments

x

a tidy tibble
model

the corresponding model, if not attached to x

Details

It will also identify interaction terms and intercept(s). var_type could be "continuous", "categorical", "intercept" or "interaction".

See also

model_identify_variables()

Other tidy_helpers: tidy_add_contrasts(), tidy_add_estimate_to_reference_rows(), tidy_add_header_rows(), tidy_add_reference_rows(), tidy_add_term_labels(), tidy_add_variable_labels(), tidy_attach_model(), tidy_plus_plus(), tidy_remove_intercept()

Examples

Titanic %>%
  dplyr::as_tibble() %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Survived = factor(Survived, c("No", "Yes"))) %>%
  glm(Survived ~ Class + Age * Sex, data = ., weights = .$n, family = binomial) %>%
  tidy_and_attach() %>%
  tidy_identify_variables()
#> # A tibble: 7 x 8
#>   term        variable var_class var_type  estimate std.error statistic  p.value
#>   <chr>       <chr>    <chr>     <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept) NA       NA        intercept    2.18      0.176    12.4   3.08e-35
#> 2 Class2nd    Class    character categori…   -1.03      0.200    -5.17  2.29e- 7
#> 3 Class3rd    Class    character categori…   -1.81      0.176   -10.3   7.79e-25
#> 4 ClassCrew   Class    character categori…   -0.803     0.160    -5.03  4.99e- 7
#> 5 AgeChild    Age      character categori…   -0.110     0.335    -0.328 7.43e- 1
#> 6 SexMale     Sex      character categori…   -2.62      0.151   -17.3   2.80e-67
#> 7 AgeChild:S… Age:Sex  NA        interact…    1.90      0.433     4.39  1.12e- 5

lm(
  Sepal.Length ~ poly(Sepal.Width, 2) + Species,
  data = iris,
  contrasts = list(Species = contr.sum)
) %>%
tidy_and_attach(conf.int = TRUE) %>%
tidy_identify_variables()
#> # A tibble: 5 x 10
#>   term  variable var_class var_type estimate std.error statistic   p.value
#>   <chr> <chr>    <chr>     <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 (Int… NA       NA        interce…   5.84      0.0359   163.    4.32e-166
#> 2 poly… Sepal.W… nmatrix.2 continu…   4.27      0.568      7.52  5.32e- 12
#> 3 poly… Sepal.W… nmatrix.2 continu…  -0.0720    0.447     -0.161 8.72e-  1
#> 4 Spec… Species  factor    categor…  -1.13      0.0647   -17.5   1.22e- 37
#> 5 Spec… Species  factor    categor…   0.324     0.0593     5.46  2.02e-  7
#> # … with 2 more variables: conf.low <dbl>, conf.high <dbl>
